private_information: I may only move blocks labelled with vowels: A, E, I, O, U.
I can only pick up and place one block at a time.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help transform the initial block stacks into the target single tower where O is on the table and A is the top block.

private_information: I may only move blocks labelled with consonants: all letters except A, E, I, O, U.
I can only pick up and place one block at a time.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help transform the initial block stacks into the target single tower where O is on the table and A is the top block.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a unified PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards planner that achieves the target tower: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, N on O, and O on the table.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks on the table.
Blocks are arranged in two stacks initially. Stack 1 from bottom to top: B, M, J, D, N, K, O, F. Stack 2 from bottom to top: I, E, H, G, L, C, A.
Only the top block of any stack is movable at any time.
Agents may pick and place only one block at a time.
One agent can only move vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I, O, U) and the other can only move consonant-labelled blocks.
The global goal is a single tower with O on the table and above it, in order from bottom to top: O, N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A (A is the top block).

analysis.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation agent restricted to vowel-labelled blocks. Based on the public information and your private knowledge, produce a structured plan fragment describing moves you can perform with vowel blocks. Describe each move as a triplet: source_stack_or_block, target_stack_or_block_or_table, block_label. Do not emit full PDDL. Focus on moves that respect the constraint that only top blocks can be moved and that you only touch vowel blocks.
analysis.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Provide stepwise, verifiable move fragments limited to vowel blocks. Output name: fragment_vowel.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation agent restricted to consonant-labelled blocks. Based on the public information and your private knowledge, produce a structured plan fragment describing moves you can perform with consonant blocks. Describe each move as a triplet: source_stack_or_block, target_stack_or_block_or_table, block_label. Do not emit full PDDL. Focus on moves that respect the constraint that only top blocks can be moved and that you only touch consonant blocks.
analysis.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Provide stepwise, verifiable move fragments limited to consonant blocks. Output name: fragment_consonant.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must integrate agent fragments and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that model the blocksworld constraints: only top blocks movable, single-block moves, and agent-side constraints (distinct action signatures or predicates to keep vowel and consonant agent actions separate if needed). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the move fragments from two agents: {vowel_agent->analysis->output} and {consonant_agent->analysis->output}. Integrate those fragments, resolve naming ambiguities, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem achieving the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep actions of the two agents distinct where appropriate. Enclose domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>. Output name: pddl_orchestrator.
